meanings.sent1: The lion tried to outkill the hyena in the hunt.
meanings.sent2: The hunter managed to outkill all his competitors in the contest.
meanings.sent3: The ninja cat thought it could outkill the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The assassin's skills could outkill any other in the underworld.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's determination to outkill the enemy was unmatched.

meanings.sent1: The virus could outkill any other disease in history.
meanings.sent2: The serial killer aimed to outkill his previous victims.
meanings.sent3: The zombie horde tried to outkill the survivors in the movie.
meanings.sent4: The poisonous snake could outkill any predator in the jungle.
meanings.sent5: The spider's venom could outkill its prey within seconds.

meanings.definition: To be more successful in killing.
meanings.sent1: The skilled archer could outkill any other competitor in the tournament.
meanings.sent2: The predator's hunting technique allowed it to outkill its prey effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The robot assassin tried to outkill its malfunctioning counterparts.
meanings.sent4: The virus mutated to outkill the body's immune system.
meanings.sent5: The alien creature's ability to outkill its enemies made it feared across galaxies.
